Package com.deco2800.game.components.maingame

Class BuffManager

java.lang.Object
com.deco2800.game.components.Component
com.deco2800.game.components.maingame.BuffManager
public class BuffManager
extends Component
Oversees the creation and management of buffs and debuffs in the game. Checks buff-related information on each frame. Handles the creation, spawning, despawning and activation of buffs and debuffs on the map. Currently, timed buffs do not stack. - Keeps track of the buffs currently spawned on the map - Keeps track of the time-based buffs which are currently affecting the player. - Handles despawning timed-out buffs. - Handles removing timed-out buffs' effects from the player when their timer is up. - Handles spawning new buffs periodically Read the documentation above BuffTypes or the wiki page for how to create new buffs

  • Constructor Details

    • BuffManager

      public BuffManager​(MainGameScreen mainGame, GameArea currentMap)
      Default constructor for the BuffManager. Sets up rudimentary information.
      Parameters:
      mainGame - the MainGameScreen that the map is currently in.
      currentMap - the current map on which the game is playing.

  • Method Details

    • getTexture

      public java.lang.String getTexture​(BuffManager.BuffTypes type)
      Returns the texture associated with a particular buff. This method must be updated when a new buff is added, otherwise a default box_boy.png sprite will be used when the buff spawns.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of buff the texture is being returned for.
      Returns:
      the filepath to the texture for this buff. This filepath must be in the MainGameScreen's buffsAndDebuffs String[], or otherwise loaded by the MainGameScreen, to work.

    • getPickupTexture

      public java.lang.String getPickupTexture​(BuffManager.BuffPickup pickup)
      Returns the texture associated with a particular pickup
      Parameters:
      pickup - the type of pickup the player hit
      Returns:
      the filepath to the texture for this pickup. This filepath must be in the MainGameScreens' buffsAndDebuffs String[], or otherwise loaded by the MainGameScreen, to work.

    • selectBuffFunctionality

      public void selectBuffFunctionality​(BuffManager.BuffTypes type, Entity buff, BuffInformation buffInfo)
      Controls which action functions to call upon the player colliding with a buff. This method must be updated when a new buff is added, otherwise the buff will not have any functionality when collided with.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of buff that was hit
      buff - the buff which was hit
      buffInfo - information about the buff which was hit

    • create

      public void create()
      Sets up listener to take action when the player collides with an object.
      Overrides:
      create in class Component

    • onCollision

      public void onCollision​(Fixture player, Fixture object)
      Activates when the player collides with something. Checks if that 'something' was a buff or debuff, and if so, applies the effects to the player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player the object collided with
      object - the object (possibly a buff) that the player collided with

    • hasTimedOut

      public boolean hasTimedOut​(Entity buff)
      Returns whether or not a spawned buff has timed out (ie, should be removed from the map as the player did not pick it up in time). Currently, buffs time out after 10 seconds.
      Parameters:
      buff - the buff we are checking the timeout of
      Returns:
      'True' if the buff has been sitting on the map for 10 or more seconds, and needs to be despawned. 'False' if not.

    • update

      public void update()
      Description copied from class: Component
      Called once per frame of the game, and should be used for most component logic. Not called if component is disabled.
      Overrides:
      update in class Component

    • registerBuff

      public void registerBuff​(BuffInformation info)
      Registers a newly-created buff with this BuffManager. Also updates the lastBuffSpawn time to the time this new buff was added.
      Parameters:
      info - information about the buff which is used to define the actions to take when a player collides with it

    • getTimedBuffs

      public java.util.Collection<BuffInformation> getTimedBuffs()
      Returns the buffs which are currently affecting the player

    • getCurrentBuffs

      public java.util.Map<Entity,​BuffInformation> getCurrentBuffs()
      Returns the buffs which are currently sitting on the map.
